intro: Zieria macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf zieria, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer, which are clustered in umbels. Zieria macrophylla is typically found in heathlands and dry forests, often growing in well-drained soils.
